casebody.data:
Robert McMenomy vs. Matthias Williamson. Upon an affidavit of the defendant, stating that the cause of action, if any, arose in the county of Essex; that the defendant resides there, and the plaintiff in New York; that the process was directed to the sheriff of Essex, and an appearance endorsed; and that the witnesses of the defendant reside in Essex; the court ordered the venue, which was laid in Bergen, to be changed to Essex. Seudder, for the defendant. Samuel Cassedy, for the plaintiff.

No opinion found. Click here to view source material.
